jobs.title: B2B Legal and Business Development Executive
jobs.description:
Seers Group is a UK based Tech company with offices in London and around the globe. We the UK's leading data privacy compliance one-stop-shop providing solutions to international small and medium-sized companies. Our company boasts a bustling and vibrant team with fantastic employee feedback across the board, as well as a great working environment. We are looking for a Sales Executive to join our fast-growing team.

Our growing company is in need of an experienced and resourceful Legal and Business Development Executive to develop and implement growth opportunities in existing and new markets. We’re searching for professionals that have a solid track record of creating long-term value for organisations.

Key responsibilities include:

This role will require you to provide in-house legal support, primarily in relation to EU and UK data privacy laws and regulations plus online data protection and compliance. From time to time, you will also provide general legal advice
The successful candidate will be involved with researching and advising ongoing data privacy laws including the GDPR as well as providing factual and expert advice. You will undertake research into data privacy issues and assist in case planning and drafting of instructions
Importantly you will monitor online enquiries and dashboards and understand the legal context to enable prioritisation
In addition, identify issues that can be actioned and those that need escalating to a Senior Legal Adviser
This role will also see you correspond directly with members, experts and other third parties when necessary
Additionally, you will be able to demonstrate investigative and analytical skills, as well as the ability to learn in-house systems quickly and comfortable on all Windows suite software.
Due to the nature of the role, you must be able to communicate effectively at all levels and work autonomously and to tight deadlines.
Ideally, you will possess a legal degree, or other relevant qualifications, and have previous experience of operating in a legal or compliance environment
Other responsibilities include:

Proactively generating new business and building new relationships within the SME sector. B2B2B and B2B.
Growing Seers footprint in the SME market and raising awareness of proposition.
Actively promote Privacy technology solutions and encourage partnership and integration where relevant.
Successfully winning business and implementing within set timescales.
Producing quality business development and marketing content and collateral
Working towards set objectives.
Attending meetings with partner organisations or prospective clients and spotting opportunities to drive forward.
Liaising with internal departments to ensure successful implementation.
Results Driven - relentless, proactive and growth focused.
Discipline and accountability.
Technical Expert – commit to learning our product, solutions and capabilities of integration.
Relationship management- Manage and nurture relationships that are won, by applying a robust contact strategy and maximising cross selling opportunities.
Display the right attitude, Candidate must be energetic, passionate, Driven, Confident and articulate.
Able to operate appropriately in a Regulatory and commercial environment.
Able to accurately feedback into the business on wins/losses and on competitors.
Strong communication skills – the ability to quickly gain trust and become a trusted advisor.
Able to manage and report on pipeline, accurately projecting forward different scenarios.
Manage CRM systems and record data accurately.
Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor's degree in law
Good knowledge of data protection market will be a plus
Good knowledge of SMEs partnerships B2B2B and B2B will be a plus
Having an excellent existing network of intermediaries with an established relationship will be a plus
Demonstrated ability to consistently form successful partnerships
Ability to prioritise tasks and deliver results in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment
Ability to interact with a broad set of businesses and presenting both over the phone and in-person
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong attention to detail, and good follow-through
Management of competing priorities across the business development team
We are an equal opportunities organisation and we welcome applications from all suitably skilled or qualified applicants, regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/beliefs, sexual orientation or age.
https://seersco.com/

jobs.title: Data Protection Advisor /Officer
jobs.description:
Seers Group is a UK based company with offices in London.

We are an online data privacy compliance one-stop shop that provides solutions to international small and medium-size companies.

Looking for the part-time dedicated advisor who provides advice and support to the Data Protection Officer about all information governance for the UK. You will have the opportunity to get advice on developing information governance policies and procedures with some subject matter experts throughout the business.
  
Key Skills and Abilities:

- Proven ability to understand and provide incisive, reliable and commercially sound advice and solutions on complex business issues

- Solid understanding of applicable European and local Privacy laws and regulations

- Experience of developing and embedding a data privacy program that ensures early and full business awareness and ownership of privacy risks.

- Comfortable in an environment with an extensive range of specialisms and responsibilities.

- Ability to translate technical and legal concepts to business areas.

Qualifications:

Legal qualification/background

Data Privacy Professional certification preferable (ISEB/IAPP)


Key Responsibilities:

- Book sessions with the clients (business) and address their concerns.

- Provide subject matter privacy advice, including new Data Protection legislation and its application to the client’s business.

- Identifies Privacy risks and issues. Advises all employees where their activities put the company at risk and provide actionable solutions to remediate risks and issues.

- To design and develop a program of work to demonstrate compliance with global privacy standards and ensure the optimum customer experience.

- Improve, drive and embed data privacy standards, governance and policies.

- Liaise with business process owners to build an understanding of Privacy risks related to their personal information processing activities and provide advice on how to mitigate risk by embedding Privacy into the design of business processes

- Act as the liaison point for privacy matters to ASOS customers. ASOS employees and DPA supervisory authorities/regulators. 

- Oversees subject data rights and requests for information.

- Drafting and advising on technical privacy and security aspects in contracts.

- Advise and support remediation and notification of PII data incidents.

- Maintain and improve a data privacy impact assessment framework and facilitate an assessment to advise on privacy risks and suggested mitigations.

- Act as the escalation point for enhanced privacy complaints and enquiries.

- Advise on marketing and third-party initiatives involving consent.

- Oversees fair processing information and privacy notices.

- Builds and maintains knowledge about applicable country privacy laws and regulations and assesses the impact of changes in laws to privacy operations.

jobs.title: Legal Intern
jobs.description:
Seers Group is a UK based Tech company with offices in London and around the globe. We the UK's leading data privacy compliance one-stop-shop providing solutions to international small and medium-sized companies. Our company boasts a bustling and vibrant team with fantastic employee feedback across the board, as well as a great working environment. We are looking for a Sales Executive to join our fast-growing team.

Our fast-growing company is looking for a Legal Intern to join our expanding legal team. Our company boasts a bustling and vibrant team with fantastic employee feedback across the board, as well as a great working environment.
As a Legal Intern, you will provide timely and practical legal assistance and advice to support our objectives. The ideal candidate will be part of our legal team involved in carrying out various administrative tasks and legal activities surrounding European laws and regulations on data privacy, GDPR compliance and data protection. Other duties include management of projects, reporting and researching legal cases, reviewing policy documents, reviewing product-related documents, marketing content to ensure that it meets legal requirements and reports.
The role would suit a law graduate ideally looking to gain practical experience working at a legal tech. The role involves an understanding of the underlying work of the company, an ability to work under pressure, consistently high quality of work output. The position required a flexible approach to dealing with a variety of urgent issues that arise on a daily basis and the ability to work on the initiative is encouraged. Being a team player is vital.
We are an equal opportunities organisation and we welcome applications from all suitably skilled or qualified applicants, regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/beliefs, sexual orientation or age.
